result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca L. Gladem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rebecca L. Gladem is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rebecca L. Gladem was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/costs $518 less $300 cash bond posted to probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Rebecca L. Gladem in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In 14CF486, Ct 1, OWI 3rd w minor.  Court imposed 12 months jail and stayed, placed on 4 years probation.    Conditions.  120 days jail with huber for work and treatment. Good time commencing 9-22-15 @ 7 pm.  Fine/costs $2452.00 DNA sample and surcharge of $250.00 ,  27 month revocation. 24 month interlock.  To complete OWI treatment court, $65 blood draw fee. Not possess/consume alcohol. Not to be upon premises where alcohol sold for on site consumption.  3 days credit.  15CF114, plea felony BJ, dismiss Counts 2.  Court withheld sentence and placed on probation 4 years., $518 costs (includes DNA surcharge) AODA and comply and DNA sample if necessary.   2 days jail credit.  15CF251, Count 1 Felony BJ.  Count 2 dismissed.  Probation 4 years, $518 including DNA surcharge and sample if necessary.  2 days credit.  AODA and comply.  15CF256,  Count 1 Felony BJ, Count 2 dismissed.  Court withheld sentence, placed on 4 years probation, $518 fine costs including DNA surcharge, 2 days jail credit.  Rights/elements.  No contest to 3 counts BJ and 1 count OWI w minor.  Court finds defendant guilty and enters JOC.  Must report to probation by 4pm.  Court dismissed Counts 2 and 3 of 14CF486.  First appearance in OWI Treatment court is September 29, 2015.
Atty. Riek requests Sept. 24th sentencing hearing be reset to a separate time - fax
